units.title: Matrigel coating and incubation
units.text: Add 300 µl Matrigel/DMEM/F12 solution, described in the Reagent setup, per well of the 24-well plate. Incubate for 1 h at 37 °C and 5% CO2 in an incubator.
units.rationale: Establishes a supportive extracellular matrix for iPSC attachment.

units.title: PFA fixation of organoids (cryosection preparation)
units.text: Add 1 ml PFA (prewarmed in a 37 °C water bath) and incubate the tube at RT for 30–60 min.
units.rationale: Fixes cellular structures while preserving morphology for downstream staining.

units.title: Microinjection of CTB tracer into optic vesicle
units.text: Fill glass capillary tip with 3 µl of CTB-488 dilution (front fill) and move the needle tip forward in front of the first pigmented area. Inject the solution into the first OV carefully, using a microscope.
units.rationale: Introduces a fluorescent tracer to map neuronal projections.

units.title: Trypsin dissociation of organoids for RPE isolation
units.text: Dissociate the organoids to small aggregates by adding 3 ml of 0.05% Trypsin and incubating for 20 min at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Breaks organoids into manageable pieces for selective RPE culture.

units.title: Accutase/DNase I dissociation for scRNA‑seq
units.text: Add 2 ml of Accutase containing 0.2 U/µl DNase I (prewarmed in a 37 °C water bath), close the tube tightly and incubate at 37 °C in a water bath.
units.rationale: Generates a single‑cell suspension while preventing DNA‑induced clumping.

units.title: Tri‑Reagent lysis for bulk RNA extraction
units.text: Add 300 µl Tri‑Reagent and incubate at RT for 5 min.
units.rationale: Lyses cells and preserves RNA for downstream sequencing.

units.title: Glutaraldehyde fixation for TEM
units.text: Fix the required number of OVB organoids by immersing them in 3–4 ml of 2.5% glutaraldehyde and 1.8% sucrose in PBS (pH 7.2), overnight at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Cross‑links proteins and stabilizes ultrastructure for electron microscopy.

units.title: ERG superfusion system setup
units.text: Set up the ERG aperture and fill the superfusion system with an oxygenated OVB medium.
units.rationale: Provides a controlled environment for recording electrical responses to light.

units.title: Matrigel‑coated dish preparation for iPSC seeding
units.text: Prepare a Matrigel‑coated dish as described in ‘Reagent setup’. Usually, we culture iPSCs in 60 mm dishes, due to the size/growth area and amount of cells we have frozen per cryovial.
units.rationale: Creates a defined surface for uniform iPSC attachment and expansion.

units.title: Half‑medium change in spinner flask culture
units.text: Perform half‑medium changes weekly. Place the bottle under the sterile hood, let the organoids settle for 3 min and then carefully aspirate 50 ml of medium without disturbing the organoids. Next, add 50 ml of fresh OVB organoid medium prewarmed in a 37 °C water bath.
units.rationale: Refreshes nutrients while minimizing disturbance of developing organoids.
